Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored twice, including a penalty and a header, as South Korea beat China 3-0.
Post-Match Reflections: The defeat leaves China third in the group, behind Thailand, who beat Singapore 3-1 on Monday, on goal difference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Son has scored 41 goals in 116 games for South Korea
The top two teams from the nine groups progress to another qualifying stage for the 2026 World Cup in North America.
Others: China 0-3 South Korea: Son Heung-min scores twice as visitors go top of World Cup qualifying group
Playing in front of a sell-out crowd of more than 40,000 in Shenzhen
